description:
As a global leader in the renewable energy sector, Ormat is continuing to grow its energy storage business. With an unwavering focus on innovation and a commitment to sustainability, Ormat Energy Storage is focused on helping to reshape the landscape of clean energy storage and utilization.

Deployment of wind, solar, geothermal and other clean, renewable energy sources is moving forward fast and we're looking for a Director of Business Development to join our team.

Position Summary

The ideal candidate will manage the Development team which leads the siting, land acquisition, interconnection and permitting of the existing pipeline of projects as well as new energy storage and solar + storage projects. The Director of Business Development is responsible for supporting due diligence of M&A efforts, guiding and supporting regulatory monitoring and policies at all levels, directing business intelligence, and gathering and providing in-depth reporting and information to company stakeholders.

Responsibilities:
• Lead the development of existing and new energy storage and solar + storage projects. This includes leading the Development team that sites new projects, acquires land position, completes the interconnection and permitting processes to support Ormat's growth targets.
• Strengthen and maintain relationships with key customers, including internal and external stakeholders.
• Understand all policies and regulatory frameworks that directly impact Ormat's business models; building and maintaining relationships with state agencies, transmission providers, contractors, consultants, etc., including at mid/senior level.
• Lead and support the promotion of Ormat's objectives with policy-makers and regulatory agencies at federal, state and local levels.
• Collaborate with Ormat's Finance team to run feasibility studies and financial modeling of new projects and prospects to make project decisions.
• Coordinate Business Development activities between various departments and stakeholders.
• Provide ongoing training and development to Business Development team.

Skills & Qualifications we're seeking:
• Bachelor's degree; MBA preferred.
• 7–10 years’ experience in project development of renewables or a relevant field.
• Ability to lead key short-term and long-term projects.
• Ability to travel up to 5% nationally, travel long distances by car and air.
• Ability to maintain timelines and budgets and communicate effectively.
• The ability and proven track record to maintain confidentiality and deal with company proprietary information.
• Must be able to operate a vehicle in a safe manner; and possess at any time a valid driver’s license with a driving record acceptable to ORMAT’s auto insurance carrier.

Physical Requirements:

The ability to work at a computer, computer monitor, and use repetitive motion for long periods of time.

Benefits:
• Competitive Health Plan - Medical PPO Network, Dental, & Vision.
• Up to 6% 401(k) match, after just 60 days!
• Generous PTO and Sick Time
• 11 Paid Holidays
• Career Development Opportunities
• Employer Paid Short & Long Term Disability
• Supplemental Benefit Options
• Relocation Assistance
• Tuition Reimbursement

Not familiar with Northern Nevada? Ormat’s Corporate Office is settled between Reno/Tahoe’s backdrop with limitless views, never-ending outdoor adventures, coupled with a fresh art, dining, and culture scene; don’t miss this opportunity to embrace the Biggest Little City lifestyle!

The information contained herein is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and qualifications required of individuals performing the job. The qualifications detailed in this job description are not considered the minimum requirements necessary to perform the job, but rather as guidelines.
